result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin C. Chmiel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Sign any releases for agent.
Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha.

No Violent or abusive contact with victim. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. Case 14CM1637 was dismissed and read in.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. To be used at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin C. Chmiel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Dated 05/12/15, from Atty LaVoy to Judge Carter, with attached documents for sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 15, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Justin C. Chmiel in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Lavoy just received discovery on the new file and a global offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with victims/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms. MODIFIED CONDITION: Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim listed in Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Justin C. Chmiel in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Court binds Defendant over for trial. Information filed. Reading is waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Atty LaVoy requests adjournment of jury trial on 14CF1059, and requests a further proceeding on all cases in 30 days. State does not object to adjournment. Atty LaVoy requests bail modification. State does not object to bail modification. Victim makes statements. Court adjourns.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victims/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant Justin C. Chmiel in court, in custody, with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.  Hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
